titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: A damp thunderous day, very depressing. I basely 'cried off' the gathering of Girl Guides at Lumley Castle, but the three ladies went. Ella talked to Princess Mary instead of me, without doubt to the advantage of both.
I worked very unsuccessfully at the Newcastle Sermon. The
in America has something like an attack on the Bishop of Durham in its article on 'English Church Life'. It is evidently inspired by

. I suppose the general mass of 'Protestants' are really in capable of distinguishing between a bishop's personal beliefs and his official action. They assume that the last must express the first. In a divided Church like ours only thorough–going partisans could satisfy them, and if anything be certainly true about me, it is that I never have been, and never can be a partisan. Nature has stamped me as a born 'mugwump'!
George desires me to be their Honorary Chaplain "in succession to our good friend Bishop Carr Glyn"!!! Have I fallen to this?
